items.title: RIL Q1 FY26: Consumer verticals drive performance, outlook remains bright
items.description: Hopes of a consumption recovery hold up the outlook for consumer-centric businesses, even as cyclical businesses battle headwinds

items.title: SEBI nod for Jane Street’s trading comeback still awaited
items.description: One week after compliance with SEBI’s escrow directive, exchanges await formal go-ahead amid concerns over surveillance of manipulative patterns.

items.title: Rare earth crisis draws PMO's attention, GMDC shares up 13% ahead of stakeholder meeting
items.description: GMDC has stated intentions of entering the critical mineral space, including rare earth, and the company has been working towards this, through it has not officially disclosed details of its plans yet.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Top stocks that moved the most on July 18
items.description: Benchmark equity indices declined sharply on July 18, dragged by weak earnings from Axis Bank, continued foreign fund outflows and negative global cues.

items.title: Tata Consultancy Services shares fall marginally in afternoon trade
items.description: With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,189.90, Tata Consultancy Services is currently trading lower compared to its previous hour price of Rs 3,192.70.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty slips below 25,000 on extended selling; Sensex sinks 502 pts
items.description: Except media and metal, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with pharma, Private Bank, PSU bank, FMCG, capital goods, consumer durables, telecom down 0.5-1 percent.

items.title: Sensex ends 500 pts lower, Nifty settles below 25,000; all eyes on HDFC Bank, RIL, ICICI Bank Q1 results
items.description: The broader market reflected similar weakness, with India VIX inching up over 1 percent, indicating a slight rise in volatility.

items.title: Nifty Plunges Below 25,000; Down For Third Straight Week | Axis Bank Top Drag | Closing Bell Live
items.description: Nifty drops below 25,000 amid triple-digit cut. Banks among top drags; Nifty bank down a percent. Poor show from Axis Bank further dampens sentiment. Third straight week of losses for the market. Mid & smallcaps move in tandem with benchmarks. NSE advance-decline ratio at 1:2. Metals extend gains; Wipro brings cheer to IT pack. Top gainers this week: Hero, M&M, Bajaj Auto, Wipro, Nestle. Top losers this week: Axis bank, HCLTech, Kotak Bank, BEL, Shriram Finance. Join Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they break down the week’s market action and highlight stocks to watch.

items.title: Business in the Week Ahead (July 21- July 25, 2025)
items.description: The manufacturing data from India, Euro area, US and the UK will be released next week. Here’s what investors can expect in the coming week

items.title: Coromandel International shares fall 2.20%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150

items.title: Dalmia Bharat, NMDC, Tata Comm among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
items.description: Based on Moneycontrol analysis as of July 16, 2025, the sentiment for these stocks is bullish.

items.title: Waaree Energies, Premier Energies, SW Solar shares fall up to 4% as US firms request tariffs on imports from India
items.description: The Alliance for American Solar Manufacturing and Trade accused these companies of dumping cheap goods in the market to undercut new American factories.

items.title: Wipro, Tata Steel stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50
items.description: Wipro and Tata Steel were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 at 2:00 pm, with Wipro showing steady financial performance and recent corporate announcements.
